Royal Park Hotel The Shiodome, Tokyo
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1988 reviews

When we arrived on March 23 via a private car, a lady from the hotel outside asked if we are to check in, when we said yes, she instructed as to go to basement parking, our driver companion who apparently is not familiar with the place parked in the basement near an access to an elevator, we unloaded our suitcases from the car, took the elevator to 2nd floor reaching a lobby which seems to be an old, unkempt reception office, I went to one lady among those seated which seemed to be receptionists and told her we are to check in in Royal Park Shiodome, she said no, not this one, it's on the other building so we took the elevator again down and finally found our way to the lobby of Royal Park Shiodome on the 24th floor.

Another incident was on March 26, a Sunday when we inquired from the Concierge about the nearest Catholic Church we can go to to hear Mass, the guy showed us a map, he thought we were looking for a gasoline station, anyway he finally understood us when I wrote the word Catholic Church, he left us saying he'll go back, when he left I approached a lady in the Concierge who was able to locate St Joseph's Parish but there was no Mass anymore when we inquired at 10:30 am, the first guy who assisted us came back saying he found a church with an 11am Mass he wrote the supposed address of the Catholic church in Japanese, we went down and took a cab immediately, the taxi driver who does not speak any English studied the address and brought us to Lutheran Church, he seems to be explaining when he noticed our flummoxed expression when we reached the place that this is the address written here, we got off the cab and found out it was a Lutheran church, we were not able to hear Mass on that day. At any rate.... when we go back to Tokyo with our children, we will still stay in your hotel.

Show more
Aileen , Philippines
Shinjuku Granbell Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 2768 reviews

Shinjuku is the first city that we stayed. From Narita Airport to the city we use Narita Express NEX to the Shinjuke station, then we walked to the hotel, it took us about 10mins to reach.

The weather is a bit windy, that's why is quite cold for this 10mins walk, otherwise the distance is actually not so bad. Good thing about this hotel is that it located quite near to the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden (within walking distance) where we enjoyed our cherry blossom viewing over there! The Samurai Museum also is a recommended place to visit near the hotel, we learnt about history of Samurai and the similarity between Samurai and Star Wars! The breakfast is more focused on western buffet style, the food is fine though not much variety. Generally i enjoy my stay in Granbell with helpful staff and very clean room~

Show more
Hui , Malaysia
APA Hotel TKP Nippori Ekimae
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1262 reviews

I thought Nippori is like a province in Japan far from the business districts and tourist spots in Japan.

Apa Hotel TKP Nippori is 5 mins walking distance from the Nippori Station and has direct access train going to Narita and the semi bullet train they call the Keisei Skyliner. If u want to experience a traditional Japanese place this is the right venue, quiet place and has a cold weather. Accessible to Shinjuku et. al (JR Yamanote Line), if going to Disney it would take 45mins travel via train with one transfer to JR Keiyo Line. Apa Hotel has a lot of food to offer esp the ramen all beside the hotel. if u want Yoshinoya u can walk 10mins going to Nishi Nippori station. I do not regret staying here, they are close to Tokyo Skytree, Sensoji Temple, The Akihabara, Asakusa. You can use the bus as transpo if you are going to Skytree and Sensoji Temple. Yanaka Ginza is also in Nippori where history of cats originated next station to Ueno Station. Ueno is like a chain of discount shop and has the high exchange rate for dollar currency to JPY. APA HOTEL offers amenities like their wifi (strong connection) Shisheido shampoo and a bathtub although the room is small like hotel rooms in Hongkong but this is more and much commended to stay compare to the hotels in HK. When I go back to Japan i will stay here again.

Show more
Marianne , Philippines
Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
8.6 Excellent
Based on 3275 reviews

The superior double room is small, my suitcase has to be closed and be in upright position constantly so I would have space to walk the corridor to the bathroom/toilet or door.

Which is a hassle because there isn't closet or enough hangers to put out the clothes for wearing. I absolutely love the modular bathroom which divides the wet and dry area. I was traveling in a group, I booked 2 rooms but the hotel staff didn't think of putting our rooms side by side, but rather to each corner of that level. I did request but it was denied (no reason was given either), so they are pretty rigid and unwilling to search for your request. No going extra mile for guest. However they allowed 1 hr late checkout at 12pm which was good! I've stayed in shinjuku kabukicho area before because it's easy access to the transport and shopping and restaurants.

Show more
Wei , Singapore
Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3379 reviews

Everything about this hotel was amazing! The place was incredible, very large rooms, clean, amazing bathroom products were great quality (branded products) and staff went above and beyond to help.

The free shuttle bus was a bonus. The hotel has lots of restaurants and shopping stores to visit (reminded us of a mix between a hotel and department store) and art gallery. Having been there in the middle of winter, there were a few very painfully cold nights where it was difficult to walk around outside as it was so incredible cold, so the amenities were a bonus. After changing hotels last minute due to a horror of a hotel we had previously arrived to, the Keio Plaza was the ultimate experience and ensured we left Tokyo on a high. They accomodated us beautifully! Well placed around the corner from all the night life in Shinjuku and the main train station. The only thing which was a bit painful was the wifi as it kept disconnecting when we left the room even though we were still inside the

Show more
Pilar , Australia
Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo
8.7 Excellent
Based on 664 reviews

We booked 3 rooms at Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo. Few weeks before staying there, I mailed them about keeping our luggages in their storage, and they replied our mail less than half an hour later, it was really fast response.

Before heading to Hakone, we asked one of their staffs about the fastest way to go to Shinjuku station to catch our romancecar, he helped us to find the fastest way, it was really helpful. Their staffs were amazing, thank you for a great service. The room itself was very clean and big. The sofa was comfortable, 6 persons can comfortably sit on it, they even put a coffee-table. The location is just one minute to metro station and 3 minutes to JR station. I tried to walk to Tokyo station and it took almost 40 minutes, not recommended to walk to Tokyo station, better go to Tokyo station by taxi (around 790 yen) or by train (133 yen with suica/pasmo).

Show more
dedy , Indonesia
Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1806 reviews

The hotel satisfied me and meet my expectations as when I choose it earlier through Agoda. Located just in the Shibuya station, thus very easy to find meals, coffee, and take trains to airport, Fuji Kawaguchiko, JR Train & metro-subway to different places in the city.

My room is facing the Shibuya crossing, it was made possible due to proactive responses from Agoda and Shibuya Excel Tokyu team since the time I booked it weeks before. The room is clean, spacious, provided with sufficient pillows, sleeping outfit. The bathroom amenities, complementary tea & coffee, are beyond the usual quality provided by other well known hotel in Asia. There's vending machine and laundromat in the my room floor, so helpful. Don't easily trust any review who claimed the bathroom is so small, it is indeed enough space with very good facility. Even hotels in Europe which located nearby the station had much smaller bathroom space then this hotel. There is Money Changer Machine in the hotel lobby (5th floor) so it's very convenience for guests to change the money! The single bed wide size is wider than the usual single bed size in Asia's hotel, so it's very comfortable. I like the open concept of wardrobe, and the WiFi connection was very good. Just within walking distance, you can go to Hachiko statue and any shops around the hotel.

Show more
DYAH , Indonesia
Centurion Hotel Ikebukuro Station
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2324 reviews

I found this hotel was wonderful! They provide you everything you need. The Location is not really far from Tokyo subway or even JR Station which takes me only 5 mins to get.

I really love that hotel provides all amenities that we might need. I don't mind with the room size which everyone said it too small as it's quite simple thing for almost every hotel in Japan but anyway still bigger than any other hotel. My package also included breakfast at Denny's and it was very convenient located on the 2nd floor in the hotel which you don't need to spend time walk around find places to have breakfast. So definitely will be return back to this hotel when I have a chance. Thumb ups!!

Show more
Ashley , Thailand
APA Hotel Shinjuku-Kabukicho Tower
8 Very good
Based on 3098 reviews

our room was confirmed with a certain price but needed to pay at the hotel. when we got to the hotel we were being charged more, showed the worker our confirmation and told us because we booked a month ago the dollar rate was different then so had to pay with the current rate.

We didnt have phone to make international call for agoda's customer service and we were tired from our long flight and walking from the train station with our luggages so we just agreed to pay because we werent going no where with trying to get the price we book it for. Next we asked the front desk if they can assist us in booking a restaurant because this certain restaurant only takes reservation, they flat out said NO. So overall they really have POOR customer service. -Room: small as expected Location: close to many restaurant that are open late, Family Mart next door, In a red light district. Station was a bit of a walk about 15mins, hard with luggage. Front desk: Needs lots of improvement on cust service

Show more
Randy , United States
Centurion Hotel Ueno
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1902 reviews

I had my first " solo" travel to Japan, Tokyo and my impression was great thank to this hotel. First the hotel is located strategically close, about 10 minutes of walk l, to train station named Ueno okonimachi .

Yet it has a 24 hr grocery store beneath it and there were plenty of good japanese restaurants on the way to or out of the hotel. More importantly if one interested with traveling to Akihabara, this hotel is the best suit and one can travel there by passing only 1 station. It is also close to Ueno park where temples and ueno zoo resides. In term of facility I was satisfied as well. Free-wifi was included so you could plan your travel. Also there were free cofee/tea served outside and free breakfast was available for everyone who stays. My main only gripe was that the room was too small for a family and its recommended if you travel by 1-2. Also if you want someone to clean you room you must leave the "please clean" sign outside. The cleaner wont clean your room without it

Show more
Samuel , Indonesia
APA Hotel & Resort Tokyo Bay Makuhari
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2377 reviews

Convenient location - less than 5 minutes walk to Makuhari Messe and less than 10 minutes walk to Mitsui Outlet.

It is a big hotel property with spring bath facilities. Although the room size is a little tiny, the essential amenities are provided. I find that the pillows are too soft thou. There are 2 convenient stores located in the hotel which is great. Have tried 3 of the restaurants (2 on the ground level and a Japanese resturant on East Wing level 2) in the hotel, food is not fantastic. It is better off having meals outside of the hotel where there are quite a number of places for dining nearby.

Show more
Mei , Singapore
The Capitol Hotel Tokyu
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 305 reviews

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay of 11 nights at this hotel in late March, early April 2013. Location. It is located in Akasaka, on a hill right behind Hie-Jinja, a major Shinto shrine of Tokyo.

One can see the hotel from Sotobori-dori, the main thoroughfare that runs in front of the shrine. But there is no access to the hotel from Sotobori-Dori. By car, one has to drive into a side street then up the hill. On foot, it is best to go up the shrine and follow a hidden footpath to the main hotel entrance. This means that the establishment is pretty much protected from the hubbub of Sotobori-Dori. There is a secluded luxury to such a location. This is very Japanese (or French for that matter.) True luxury is never displayed ostentatiously but kept somewhat hidden. However, seclusion in this case does not mean isolation. Indeed, one simply has to go up to the shrine from the hotel, go down the main staircase to Sotobori-dori, and cross to the other side to find oneself in the action of the back alleys of Akasaka. Shops, restaurants, bars, nightclubs of all stripes. Going up Sotobori-dori, one soon runs into Aoyama-dori, another major thoroughfare lined with all manners of fancy establishments, for example a dealer for McLaren cars! In a nutshell, this location combines the best of both worlds: quiet uncrowdedness but not too far from the ‘action’ should one chooses to partake. This is a rare combination in Tokyo. Places like Shibuya and Shinjuku are quite lively but there, one could never escape from the crush of humanity. Finally, I enjoyed very much going through the shrine everyday as I came and went. Transportation. There is a subway station right below the hotel. One can take the elevator in front of the bell captain’s desk down to the station. Officially it is Tameike-sanno but like most subway stations in Tokyo, it is linked via tunnels to many neighboring stations. In this case, one could walk from Tameike-sanno to Kokkai-gijidomae, and even Nagata-cho and Akasaka

Show more
Minh , United States
Hundred Stay Tokyo Shinjuku
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1991 reviews

We got an upgrade to a premium room. The views were just amazing. Our stay at Hundred Stay was great.

- Room: very large for the japanese standard. I would say the room had around 25sq meters. Comfortable bed with a couple of pillows per person, nice views, spacious bathroom, many towels (including a bath robe), indoor shoes, large wardrobes, free tea & coffe, small fridge, sound system. - Cleanliness: Very clean. The only con is that they clean once every three days due to an eco plan. That was fine with us. - Staff: We did not have too much contact with them because we didn't need (the less you need them the better your stay!). At the arrival they were very friendly, they upgraded us and provided clear instructions in english. At departure they also were very friendly and even opened us a staff back door that was a shortcut because we were heading to the train station with heavy luggage. - Location: Quite ok. It is located in the korean district, very close to okubo station (JR pass is ok) and 500 m to Shin-okubo train statin (JR pass valid). Shinjuku is 15 min walk. Many restaurants around and shops. - Breakfast: Acceptable. People say that it's very poor and bla bla bla. Comeon, its Japan! what did you expect? Japanase do not eat continental breakfasts. And this is fine to be continental. You have coffee, milk, juices, croisants, toasts, sausages, marmalade, yoghourt with tasty fruit, cereals... not enough? - Gym: small but fine. Two running belts, bike, weights... Japanese do not make sports, so finding a small gym in this hotel was a nice surprise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone !!!

Show more
Daniel , Spain
APA Hotel Shinjuku-Gyoemmae
8 Very good
Based on 1145 reviews

The location is excellent, many things are walking distance. The street has many restaurants and stores.

The room was larger for Japan (double room) and clean. TV was really big but the only english channel is BBC news. For the price of the room we felt they could have thrown in the video on demand price of $10 a night. They don't change the sheets unless you request it but the bed and duvet were very comfortable. The worst part about the stay is the staff. The front desk was polite and helpful but the bellstaff are a bit aggressive and dismissive. In the morning when you leave the elevator they're really in your face and keep asking if you're checking out and dismissive of any other questions you might have. I would stay here again if the rate was better, but it's kind of expensive.

Show more
Cindy , Canada
Hotel Sardonyx Ueno
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3927 reviews

It's a love place to stay and my criticism below about its ignorance of the law shouldn't be taken as negative feedback of the facilities or general hospitality of this hotel.

It's in a good location and I've enjoyed staying here very much. I would like them to improve their breakfast in terms of quantity but there are optional extras available for a price. According to the law, anyone expect the police and immigration shouldn't ask for the identity cards of Japanese citizens AND residents of Japan (foreigners). Yet, the hotel asked for my residence card and when I instead showed them my university ID, they copied it. Establishments are legally not meant to do so, and while they often cite local police guidelines, it is still against the law as it is discriminatory towards the residents of Japan who "look" like a foreigner. Basically, if one has an address in Japan, they aren't meant to be asked for any identity documents by any private establishments like hotels.

Show more
Varun , India
Hotel Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku
8.3 Excellent
Based on 8370 reviews

IF the staff of Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku told or asked us why we got double booking group and personal for the night of 24 April ( we checked in 21 April extend 1 night 24 April) also buying shuttle bus to Narita airport early morning 6 am of 25 April while in system showing had booking with Booking.

com all this mess will clear before the deadline of Agoda and booking.com. About coupons breakfast they also make a mess ( very hard for me to explain here) . Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku only sent us a notice ( under our room door ) on 24 April 2017. We only read this letter while we got back from shopping and early dinner around 5 to 6 Pm. Sunroute Shinjuku told us too late to cancel both double booking Agoda 24 April and booking.com 25 April ( I did not aware I had booking with booking.com for the night of 25 April). So they said we stayed 1 night 24 April needed to pay 3 nights. Further I paid expensive to the group for the extension night (night 24 April 2017 . Paid group travel yen 22000). Thinking I would not need to move room. While checked in the staff said if you did not want to move room need to pay extra Yen 8640,- We paid the staff on 22 April morning extra Yen 8640 not to move room. Very messy in term of management and staff. I thought should show in their system and they should ask.

Show more
freddy , Indonesia
Sunshine City Prince Hotel Ikebukuro Tokyo
8 Very good
Based on 1188 reviews

Location of the hotel is about 20 minutes long walk from Ikebukuro East Metro station. Half in open street area, the other half is the walk within the Sunshine City mall to the hotel.

There are shops along the way to distract your mind from the long walk, if that helps. Room condition is long overdue for upgrade. Room ventilation is really poor. I stayed over during the winter. The 'air outlet' flow was terribly weak. I had it set to HIGH. Air flow was weaker than me trying to blow out air from my mouth. I called the hotel to complain about the stuffiness and warmness of the room. So they set the temperature accordingly to ensure cold air is delivered. After 15 minutes wait, no difference despite the adjustment made. I proceeded to downstairs to get some help. After speaking to 3 really friendly staffs, who speak Japanese, English and Mandarin one after another. Conclusion: Nothing can be done to make the situation better. The window is fixed for safety purposes, so it cant be open. Finally, i was presented with a fan! My first unique encounter. I laughed. Speechless. When asked for a room change, i was told i may need to top up since it will be a bigger room. I didnt need a bigger room..i needed a room with better air ventilation! While I appreciate the staffs that attended me was friendly and helpful, unfortunately they are not effective. Was told i am not the only customer that had complaint about the same problem and there is nothing they can do about it bcos it is an old hotel. In all honesty, for the price paid, you could easily get a better hotel within ikebukuro. Note that this hotel do not provide complimentary bottle water either.TV was the size of a LCD monitor. You can hear your next room neighbour's conversation/activities should they are a little louder. These are no big issue compared to the stuffy room. I gather this hotel takes in majority tour groups; lobby crowded with groups of tourist and luggages/boxes here and there with netting over it.

Show more
Lan , Malaysia
APA Hotel Keisei Ueno-Ekimae
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2390 reviews

Really—really happy with the location, hotel is right in front of you if you come out from 池之端口。However, I am not happy with the breakfast price, I don't think you need to spend 1300-1500 yen for what you get.

Don't get me wrong, food is not bad, but lack of option—for this price. Clean room but not happy with the pillow option, also, I lived right next to the exit and heard some noise almost whole night; hotel itself is kind of cold, room AC only have heater option. (I guess that make sense for Winter, but I rather to be the person deciding myself.) Facility: The facility and room was very clean, washrooms, showers, and sheets. Service/Hosts: I cannot comment on this, the one host I dealt with did not speak English but was very friendly, and we communicated non-verbally. I noticed that she did not change the bed comforter which was already used by the prior guest in the room, so I decided not use it and asked her to just remove it because the room is equipped with a good heater. 8.3 Excellent

We really enjoyed our stay here! It was away from the usual tourist area (we rarely saw another tourist in the street), but still very close to public transport to the airport and other areas of the city.

The supermarket across the road sells fabulous takeaway meals and there are several restaurants nearby. The apartment is basic but clean and more spacious than a hotel room if you are travelling as a family. The street outside isn't very glamorous, but we really enjoyed getting a sense of what everyday life is like in Tokyo. It was great value for money. One handy hint - print out the address in English and Japanese, plus a map showing where it is, as it is quite tricky to find.

Cynthia Studio -North Shinjuku
9 Excellent

I have a bit of a sensitive nose. This is my second time on tatami mats but the tatami mats in this apartment have quite a strong smell.

Also there are quite a number of decorations using raw twine so if you have allergies - this would not work for you. Otherwise, bring anti-histamines. The signboard of the apartment was not obvious under daylight and I was silly looking for a triangular rooftop from the pic but there is none on the actual apartment - appears to be a reflection from the opp. building. Was accosted by a Buddhist religious group right at the apt doorstep who appeared friendly but kept on and on persuading you to join them at their temple the next day. Ok, now the positives - the owners are good & friendly folks, there is EVERYTHING you would possibly need in the apt (there are even sanitary pads provided?!!), enroute is this canal that is flanked by cherry blossoms... gorgeous... supermarket nearby at the mall which closes at 10pm, vending machines just outside the apt if you ever need a quick drink. Really convenient to tour Tokyo as train station is not too far off, safe environment BUT I can hear the railway (not loud but I can distinctly hear it with windows closed) - so if you are a very light sleeper... take note. So pros and cons... I would give an average rating as I have a sensitive nose & i'm a light sleeper :p but really the folks are nice ppl :)

I stayed at this rented apartment on Jul 22-24 and would like to share review here for your information.

Location This rented apartment is very near Kinshicho station that locates both normal subway and JR line. So, it's very convenience for transportation. Moreover, apartment's location is very near the station. You can walk around 2 mins from station to apartment. The apartment is surrounded by convenience stores and restaurants. So, you can enjoy food any times you want. Location around is also surrounded by department stores and shopping stores. So, shoppaholic tourist can enjoy shopping around. Apartment itself The apartment is suited room with kitchen, 1 bathroom and 1 toilet. Apartment is very clean and spacious enough for 6 persons (Asian Size, if you are western guys, 4-5 persons should still be fine). When you book this apartment, the apartment owner (Mr. Maruyama) will send you all details for this apartment via mail. He is very helpful. Last but not least, he'll also provide 1 free pocket Wi-Fi for you, so social network addicted (like myself) can enjoy net all time. Cost When compare to some other hotel, this place offers good and reasonable cost, especially when sharing cost with friends (my group is 6 persons, so cost/person is quite ok). Caution This place is not hotel but rented apartment. So, there is no breakfast and room service. Also you need to clear apartment check-out. However, I think it's not problem at all. I recommend this apartment. If you visit Tokyo in group and searching for place to stay with great location and reasonable cost.

More about Tokyo

The city of Tokyo is perched on the Japanese island of Honshu and is a beautiful clash of tradition and the futuristic. Exploring the wonders of this city is made all the more enjoyable with a hyper-efficient rail network connected the city’s 23 wards. The vast majority of Tokyo hotels are within a few minutes’ walk of a train station or two, meaning visitors to this city have less time to worry about how to get around and more time to enjoy themselves. The JR Yamanote train line boasts the city’s most popular areas.

The business traveler could very well find themselves settling into the Shinjuku area with executive class hotels. The younger crowds make their way to the shopping and nightlife area of Shibuya with its trendy bars and fashionable shopping. In the Harajuku area, visitors will find a more fashionable atmosphere with boutiques aplenty. Meiji Shrine is an excellent cultural attraction in an evergreen forest, and the tech-savvy will find a bit of paradise at Akihabara, an area famous for its incredible selection of electronics. Those traveling to Japan will most likely find themselves in Narita International Airport, the gateway serving international flights that is located about 60km from Tokyo.

LinkPoints Programme Qatar Airways Privilege Club reward-U Royal Skies Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer SkyPearl Club SM Advantage/ BDO Rewards Thai Airways Royal Orchid Plus The 1 Card Thailand TudoAzul United MileagePlus Velocity Frequent Flyer WAON POINT Featured Hotels Hotel Resort Guest House Apartment Villa Royal Park Hotel The Shiodome, Tokyo 8.7 Excellent Based on 1988 reviews When we arrived on March 23 via a private car, a lady from the hotel outside asked if we are to check in, when we said yes, she instructed as to go to basement parking, our driver companion who apparently is not familiar with the place parked in the basement near an access to an elevator, we unloaded our suitcases from the car, took the elevator to 2nd floor reaching a lobby which seems to be an old, unkempt reception office, I went to one lady among those seated which seemed to be receptionists and told her we are to check in in Royal Park Shiodome, she said no, not this one, it's on the other building so we took the elevator again down and finally found our way to the lobby of Royal Park Shiodome on the 24th floor. Another incident was on March 26, a Sunday when we inquired from the Concierge about the nearest Catholic Church we can go to to hear Mass, the guy showed us a map, he thought we were looking for a gasoline station, anyway he finally understood us when I wrote the word Catholic Church, he left us saying he'll go back, when he left I approached a lady in the Concierge who was able to locate St Joseph's Parish but there was no Mass anymore when we inquired at 10:30 am, the first guy who assisted us came back saying he found a church with an 11am Mass he wrote the supposed address of the Catholic church in Japanese, we went down and took a cab immediately, the taxi driver who does not speak any English studied the address and brought us to Lutheran Church, he seems to be explaining when he noticed our flummoxed expression when we reached the place that this is the address written here, we got off the cab and found out it was a Lutheran church, we were not able to hear Mass on that day. At any rate.... when we go back to Tokyo with our children, we will still stay in your hotel. Show more Aileen , Philippines Shinjuku Granbell Hotel 8 Very good Based on 2768 reviews Shinjuku is the first city that we stayed. From Narita Airport to the city we use Narita Express NEX to the Shinjuke station, then we walked to the hotel, it took us about 10mins to reach. The weather is a bit windy, that's why is quite cold for this 10mins walk, otherwise the distance is actually not so bad. Good thing about this hotel is that it located quite near to the Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden (within walking distance) where we enjoyed our cherry blossom viewing over there! The Samurai Museum also is a recommended place to visit near the hotel, we learnt about history of Samurai and the similarity between Samurai and Star Wars! The breakfast is more focused on western buffet style, the food is fine though not much variety. Generally i enjoy my stay in Granbell with helpful staff and very clean room~ Show more Hui , Malaysia APA Hotel TKP Nippori Ekimae 8.6 Excellent Based on 1262 reviews I thought Nippori is like a province in Japan far from the business districts and tourist spots in Japan. Apa Hotel TKP Nippori is 5 mins walking distance from the Nippori Station and has direct access train going to Narita and the semi bullet train they call the Keisei Skyliner. If u want to experience a traditional Japanese place this is the right venue, quiet place and has a cold weather. Accessible to Shinjuku et. al (JR Yamanote Line), if going to Disney it would take 45mins travel via train with one transfer to JR Keiyo Line. Apa Hotel has a lot of food to offer esp the ramen all beside the hotel. if u want Yoshinoya u can walk 10mins going to Nishi Nippori station. I do not regret staying here, they are close to Tokyo Skytree, Sensoji Temple, The Akihabara, Asakusa. You can use the bus as transpo if you are going to Skytree and Sensoji Temple. Yanaka Ginza is also in Nippori where history of cats originated next station to Ueno Station. Ueno is like a chain of discount shop and has the high exchange rate for dollar currency to JPY. APA HOTEL offers amenities like their wifi (strong connection) Shisheido shampoo and a bathtub although the room is small like hotel rooms in Hongkong but this is more and much commended to stay compare to the hotels in HK. When I go back to Japan i will stay here again. Show more Marianne , Philippines Hotel Gracery Shinjuku 8.6 Excellent Based on 3275 reviews The superior double room is small, my suitcase has to be closed and be in upright position constantly so I would have space to walk the corridor to the bathroom/toilet or door. Which is a hassle because there isn't closet or enough hangers to put out the clothes for wearing. I absolutely love the modular bathroom which divides the wet and dry area. I was traveling in a group, I booked 2 rooms but the hotel staff didn't think of putting our rooms side by side, but rather to each corner of that level. I did request but it was denied (no reason was given either), so they are pretty rigid and unwilling to search for your request. No going extra mile for guest. However they allowed 1 hr late checkout at 12pm which was good! I've stayed in shinjuku kabukicho area before because it's easy access to the transport and shopping and restaurants. Show more Wei , Singapore Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo 8.3 Excellent Based on 3379 reviews Everything about this hotel was amazing! The place was incredible, very large rooms, clean, amazing bathroom products were great quality (branded products) and staff went above and beyond to help. The free shuttle bus was a bonus. The hotel has lots of restaurants and shopping stores to visit (reminded us of a mix between a hotel and department store) and art gallery. Having been there in the middle of winter, there were a few very painfully cold nights where it was difficult to walk around outside as it was so incredible cold, so the amenities were a bonus. After changing hotels last minute due to a horror of a hotel we had previously arrived to, the Keio Plaza was the ultimate experience and ensured we left Tokyo on a high. They accomodated us beautifully! Well placed around the corner from all the night life in Shinjuku and the main train station. The only thing which was a bit painful was the wifi as it kept disconnecting when we left the room even though we were still inside the Show more Pilar , Australia Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo 8.7 Excellent Based on 664 reviews We booked 3 rooms at Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo. Few weeks before staying there, I mailed them about keeping our luggages in their storage, and they replied our mail less than half an hour later, it was really fast response. Before heading to Hakone, we asked one of their staffs about the fastest way to go to Shinjuku station to catch our romancecar, he helped us to find the fastest way, it was really helpful. Their staffs were amazing, thank you for a great service. The room itself was very clean and big. The sofa was comfortable, 6 persons can comfortably sit on it, they even put a coffee-table. The location is just one minute to metro station and 3 minutes to JR station. I tried to walk to Tokyo station and it took almost 40 minutes, not recommended to walk to Tokyo station, better go to Tokyo station by taxi (around 790 yen) or by train (133 yen with suica/pasmo). Show more dedy , Indonesia Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu 8.4 Excellent Based on 1806 reviews The hotel satisfied me and meet my expectations as when I choose it earlier through Agoda. Located just in the Shibuya station, thus very easy to find meals, coffee, and take trains to airport, Fuji Kawaguchiko, JR Train & metro-subway to different places in the city. My room is facing the Shibuya crossing, it was made possible due to proactive responses from Agoda and Shibuya Excel Tokyu team since the time I booked it weeks before. The room is clean, spacious, provided with sufficient pillows, sleeping outfit. The bathroom amenities, complementary tea & coffee, are beyond the usual quality provided by other well known hotel in Asia. There's vending machine and laundromat in the my room floor, so helpful. Don't easily trust any review who claimed the bathroom is so small, it is indeed enough space with very good facility. Even hotels in Europe which located nearby the station had much smaller bathroom space then this hotel. There is Money Changer Machine in the hotel lobby (5th floor) so it's very convenience for guests to change the money! The single bed wide size is wider than the usual single bed size in Asia's hotel, so it's very comfortable. I like the open concept of wardrobe, and the WiFi connection was very good. Just within walking distance, you can go to Hachiko statue and any shops around the hotel. Show more DYAH , Indonesia Centurion Hotel Ikebukuro Station 8.4 Excellent Based on 2324 reviews I found this hotel was wonderful! They provide you everything you need. The Location is not really far from Tokyo subway or even JR Station which takes me only 5 mins to get. I really love that hotel provides all amenities that we might need. I don't mind with the room size which everyone said it too small as it's quite simple thing for almost every hotel in Japan but anyway still bigger than any other hotel. My package also included breakfast at Denny's and it was very convenient located on the 2nd floor in the hotel which you don't need to spend time walk around find places to have breakfast. So definitely will be return back to this hotel when I have a chance. Thumb ups!! Show more Ashley , Thailand APA Hotel Shinjuku-Kabukicho Tower 8 Very good Based on 3098 reviews our room was confirmed with a certain price but needed to pay at the hotel. when we got to the hotel we were being charged more, showed the worker our confirmation and told us because we booked a month ago the dollar rate was different then so had to pay with the current rate. We didnt have phone to make international call for agoda's customer service and we were tired from our long flight and walking from the train station with our luggages so we just agreed to pay because we werent going no where with trying to get the price we book it for. Next we asked the front desk if they can assist us in booking a restaurant because this certain restaurant only takes reservation, they flat out said NO. So overall they really have POOR customer service. -Room: small as expected Location: close to many restaurant that are open late, Family Mart next door, In a red light district. Station was a bit of a walk about 15mins, hard with luggage. Front desk: Needs lots of improvement on cust service Show more Randy , United States Centurion Hotel Ueno 8.1 Excellent Based on 1902 reviews I had my first " solo" travel to Japan, Tokyo and my impression was great thank to this hotel. First the hotel is located strategically close, about 10 minutes of walk l, to train station named Ueno okonimachi . Yet it has a 24 hr grocery store beneath it and there were plenty of good japanese restaurants on the way to or out of the hotel. More importantly if one interested with traveling to Akihabara, this hotel is the best suit and one can travel there by passing only 1 station. It is also close to Ueno park where temples and ueno zoo resides. In term of facility I was satisfied as well. Free-wifi was included so you could plan your travel. Also there were free cofee/tea served outside and free breakfast was available for everyone who stays. My main only gripe was that the room was too small for a family and its recommended if you travel by 1-2. Also if you want someone to clean you room you must leave the "please clean" sign outside. The cleaner wont clean your room without it Show more Samuel , Indonesia APA Hotel & Resort Tokyo Bay Makuhari 8.1 Excellent Based on 2377 reviews Convenient location - less than 5 minutes walk to Makuhari Messe and less than 10 minutes walk to Mitsui Outlet. It is a big hotel property with spring bath facilities. Although the room size is a little tiny, the essential amenities are provided. I find that the pillows are too soft thou. There are 2 convenient stores located in the hotel which is great. Have tried 3 of the restaurants (2 on the ground level and a Japanese resturant on East Wing level 2) in the hotel, food is not fantastic. It is better off having meals outside of the hotel where there are quite a number of places for dining nearby. Show more Mei , Singapore The Capitol Hotel Tokyu 9.2 Exceptional Based on 305 reviews I thoroughly enjoyed my stay of 11 nights at this hotel in late March, early April 2013. Location. It is located in Akasaka, on a hill right behind Hie-Jinja, a major Shinto shrine of Tokyo. One can see the hotel from Sotobori-dori, the main thoroughfare that runs in front of the shrine. But there is no access to the hotel from Sotobori-Dori. By car, one has to drive into a side street then up the hill. On foot, it is best to go up the shrine and follow a hidden footpath to the main hotel entrance. This means that the establishment is pretty much protected from the hubbub of Sotobori-Dori. There is a secluded luxury to such a location. This is very Japanese (or French for that matter.) True luxury is never displayed ostentatiously but kept somewhat hidden. However, seclusion in this case does not mean isolation. Indeed, one simply has to go up to the shrine from the hotel, go down the main staircase to Sotobori-dori, and cross to the other side to find oneself in the action of the back alleys of Akasaka. Shops, restaurants, bars, nightclubs of all stripes. Going up Sotobori-dori, one soon runs into Aoyama-dori, another major thoroughfare lined with all manners of fancy establishments, for example a dealer for McLaren cars! In a nutshell, this location combines the best of both worlds: quiet uncrowdedness but not too far from the ‘action’ should one chooses to partake. This is a rare combination in Tokyo. Places like Shibuya and Shinjuku are quite lively but there, one could never escape from the crush of humanity. Finally, I enjoyed very much going through the shrine everyday as I came and went. Transportation. There is a subway station right below the hotel. One can take the elevator in front of the bell captain’s desk down to the station. Officially it is Tameike-sanno but like most subway stations in Tokyo, it is linked via tunnels to many neighboring stations. In this case, one could walk from Tameike-sanno to Kokkai-gijidomae, and even Nagata-cho and Akasaka Show more Minh , United States Hundred Stay Tokyo Shinjuku 8.1 Excellent Based on 1991 reviews We got an upgrade to a premium room. The views were just amazing. Our stay at Hundred Stay was great. - Room: very large for the japanese standard. I would say the room had around 25sq meters. Comfortable bed with a couple of pillows per person, nice views, spacious bathroom, many towels (including a bath robe), indoor shoes, large wardrobes, free tea & coffe, small fridge, sound system. - Cleanliness: Very clean. The only con is that they clean once every three days due to an eco plan. That was fine with us. - Staff: We did not have too much contact with them because we didn't need (the less you need them the better your stay!). At the arrival they were very friendly, they upgraded us and provided clear instructions in english. At departure they also were very friendly and even opened us a staff back door that was a shortcut because we were heading to the train station with heavy luggage. - Location: Quite ok. It is located in the korean district, very close to okubo station (JR pass is ok) and 500 m to Shin-okubo train statin (JR pass valid). Shinjuku is 15 min walk. Many restaurants around and shops. - Breakfast: Acceptable. People say that it's very poor and bla bla bla. Comeon, its Japan! what did you expect? Japanase do not eat continental breakfasts. And this is fine to be continental. You have coffee, milk, juices, croisants, toasts, sausages, marmalade, yoghourt with tasty fruit, cereals... not enough? - Gym: small but fine. Two running belts, bike, weights... Japanese do not make sports, so finding a small gym in this hotel was a nice surprise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone !!! Show more Daniel , Spain APA Hotel Shinjuku-Gyoemmae 8 Very good Based on 1145 reviews The location is excellent, many things are walking distance. The street has many restaurants and stores. The room was larger for Japan (double room) and clean. TV was really big but the only english channel is BBC news. For the price of the room we felt they could have thrown in the video on demand price of $10 a night. They don't change the sheets unless you request it but the bed and duvet were very comfortable. The worst part about the stay is the staff. The front desk was polite and helpful but the bellstaff are a bit aggressive and dismissive. In the morning when you leave the elevator they're really in your face and keep asking if you're checking out and dismissive of any other questions you might have. I would stay here again if the rate was better, but it's kind of expensive. Show more Cindy , Canada Hotel Sardonyx Ueno 8.4 Excellent Based on 3927 reviews It's a love place to stay and my criticism below about its ignorance of the law shouldn't be taken as negative feedback of the facilities or general hospitality of this hotel. It's in a good location and I've enjoyed staying here very much. I would like them to improve their breakfast in terms of quantity but there are optional extras available for a price. According to the law, anyone expect the police and immigration shouldn't ask for the identity cards of Japanese citizens AND residents of Japan (foreigners). Yet, the hotel asked for my residence card and when I instead showed them my university ID, they copied it. Establishments are legally not meant to do so, and while they often cite local police guidelines, it is still against the law as it is discriminatory towards the residents of Japan who "look" like a foreigner. Basically, if one has an address in Japan, they aren't meant to be asked for any identity documents by any private establishments like hotels. Show more Varun , India Hotel Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku 8.3 Excellent Based on 8370 reviews IF the staff of Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku told or asked us why we got double booking group and personal for the night of 24 April ( we checked in 21 April extend 1 night 24 April) also buying shuttle bus to Narita airport early morning 6 am of 25 April while in system showing had booking with Booking. com all this mess will clear before the deadline of Agoda and booking.com. About coupons breakfast they also make a mess ( very hard for me to explain here) . Sunroute Plaza Shinjuku only sent us a notice ( under our room door ) on 24 April 2017. We only read this letter while we got back from shopping and early dinner around 5 to 6 Pm. Sunroute Shinjuku told us too late to cancel both double booking Agoda 24 April and booking.com 25 April ( I did not aware I had booking with booking.com for the night of 25 April). So they said we stayed 1 night 24 April needed to pay 3 nights. Further I paid expensive to the group for the extension night (night 24 April 2017 . Paid group travel yen 22000). Thinking I would not need to move room. While checked in the staff said if you did not want to move room need to pay extra Yen 8640,- We paid the staff on 22 April morning extra Yen 8640 not to move room. Very messy in term of management and staff. I thought should show in their system and they should ask. Show more freddy , Indonesia Sunshine City Prince Hotel Ikebukuro Tokyo 8 Very good Based on 1188 reviews Location of the hotel is about 20 minutes long walk from Ikebukuro East Metro station. Half in open street area, the other half is the walk within the Sunshine City mall to the hotel. There are shops along the way to distract your mind from the long walk, if that helps. Room condition is long overdue for upgrade. Room ventilation is really poor. I stayed over during the winter. The 'air outlet' flow was terribly weak. I had it set to HIGH. Air flow was weaker than me trying to blow out air from my mouth. I called the hotel to complain about the stuffiness and warmness of the room. So they set the temperature accordingly to ensure cold air is delivered. After 15 minutes wait, no difference despite the adjustment made. I proceeded to downstairs to get some help. After speaking to 3 really friendly staffs, who speak Japanese, English and Mandarin one after another. Conclusion: Nothing can be done to make the situation better. The window is fixed for safety purposes, so it cant be open. Finally, i was presented with a fan! My first unique encounter. I laughed. Speechless. When asked for a room change, i was told i may need to top up since it will be a bigger room. I didnt need a bigger room..i needed a room with better air ventilation! While I appreciate the staffs that attended me was friendly and helpful, unfortunately they are not effective. Was told i am not the only customer that had complaint about the same problem and there is nothing they can do about it bcos it is an old hotel. In all honesty, for the price paid, you could easily get a better hotel within ikebukuro. Note that this hotel do not provide complimentary bottle water either.TV was the size of a LCD monitor. You can hear your next room neighbour's conversation/activities should they are a little louder. These are no big issue compared to the stuffy room. I gather this hotel takes in majority tour groups; lobby crowded with groups of tourist and luggages/boxes here and there with netting over it. Show more Lan , Malaysia APA Hotel Keisei Ueno-Ekimae 8.5 Excellent Based on 2390 reviews Really—really happy with the location, hotel is right in front of you if you come out from 池之端口。However, I am not happy with the breakfast price, I don't think you need to spend 1300-1500 yen for what you get. Don't get me wrong, food is not bad, but lack of option—for this price. Clean room but not happy with the pillow option, also, I lived right next to the exit and heard some noise almost whole night; hotel itself is kind of cold, room AC only have heater option. (I guess that make sense for Winter, but I rather to be the person deciding myself.) Honestly, I would probably go to other hotels next time considering so many around Ueno station, but for those of you are not picky about small details and have to catch up early Skyliner, I would recommend this hotel for you. Show more Yihsuan , Taiwan Richmond Hotel Premier Asakusa International 9 Excellent Based on 1256 reviews + The hotel is situated in the center of Asakusa district. it is very easy to get to Sensoji temple or Nakamise street. The area is surrounded by supermarkets (Don Quixote - Donki), conbini, and many restaurants (even ones that open 24 hrs like McDonald's or some Izakaya's). + This is a 'hotel complex', so the reception counter is on the 5th floor, while the lower floors are shopping arcade and restaurants, which is really convenient if you don't want to walk far to buy some souvenirs (Donki also have them). + The terrace on the 5th floor has a nice view of Tokyo Skytree. - Getting to the hotel by trains or subways could be a little difficult for people with heavy luggage, since they don't provide airport shuttles. the nearest train station is Tsukuba Express' Asakusa station, which can be connected to JR trains via Akihabara or Minami-Senju station. So you better be informed about this. At this price, you should at least have air humidifier in the room during winter, despite those unnecessary amenities. I don't know if it's the hotel policy to not take out the empty cans or bottles during my stay? I have separated them nicely in the bag, but you just let them sit there for 5 days without taking them out. Well, your room is not so big, you see, so leave the cans and bottles to accumulate for 5 days without taking them out is not a wise policy at all. Show more Puchong , Thailand Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel 8.7 Excellent Based on 1482 reviews Stayed at the Cerulean early this year and loved it so much that I decided to bring my family back for 7 nights for our holiday. Every minute of my previous stay had been wonderful, and I wanted my family to have the experience I did. Unfortunately this time around, my experience wasn't as great. Right from check-in, my experience with the staff (as well as individual family members on different occasions) was truly disappointing. We arrived very early at 8am and were condescendingly told that check-in wouldn't be possible until 2pm (no warm welcome, etc). Excited to head out, we decided to leave our luggages in the hotel but we needed to grab our coats from our bags first since it was 5 degrees out. The porter stood over us waiting with tags in hand while we were unlocking our bags and grabbing essentials, asking about 2 minutes in "are you ready". We frantically closed our bags and passed them to the porter, but my mother was grabbing her medication and was a little slower than the rest of us. He then said to her "just bring your bag there when you are done", and walked away. Now, this was at 8am and there was no one else waiting to check in or get their bags seen to. I dismissed it because this isn't the type of Japanese hospitality I'm used to, and he looked new. Few days in, we had a 13 year old who wanted McDonald's for breakfast so we went online to have them deliver to the hotel reception. We included the room number so reception would be able to call us when the delivery guy arrived. My mother was dressed and ready to head downstairs as soon as they called; however about an hour later one of the hotel staff arrived at our door with the delivery guy. This hotel staff proceeded to tell her rudely that "next time please go to reception. You have to collect it yourself downstairs." I then politely told him that I had indicated on the order that I would collect it at reception, and had included my room number so front desk could call me, but no call had come Show more Fannison , Singapore Mitsui Garden Hotel Ginza Premier 8.7 Excellent Based on 835 reviews Chose Mitsui Garden because we couldn't get a room at nearby Courtyard Marriott. Friendly staff made up for an otherwise average stay. Room had a good view of surrounding areas. The room was smaller than we had expected but was bright (which we like) due to the large window. As a frequent visitor to Japan for both business and leisure, we are well aware of size of hotel rooms but still, we were caught out for this one. As the room was small, we had limited space for our luggage. Luckily the window ledge was large enough to accommodate our two suitcases. If not for this, we would have no space to move about in the room. The staff at the reception were always friendly and helpful and were able to serve our needs at all times (making reservations, asking for dinner suggestions, etc). However, the reception/lobby area was always crowded with guests waiting to check in/check out and making inquiries. It seems like you cannot escape the crowd even at your own hotel. It appeared too that majority of the guests are made up of tourists with perhaps some tour groups too, although they don't seem to be big groups. Location wise, it's far enough from the hustle and bustle of Ginza to be quiet and not too far away from the subway/JR train stations. The plus point is the hotel is served directly by the Airport Limousine to Narita Airport. Will we return? Perhaps. If the other hotel alternatives are not available. Show more Patrick , Singapore Grand Nikko Tokyo Daiba 8.8 Excellent Based on 2571 reviews This is a lovely hotel very grand and marble. I arrived early and they promptly took my luggage whilst I checked in. I couldn't check in early, I did try but the hotel staff English wasn't that great but she didn't really check properly for me she just kept saying come back at 3. It's lucky the hotel is within walking distance with 3 malls so I just went shopping. Rooms are a nice size - didn't get a rainbow bridge view room but the view was still nice. Bathrooms are gorgeous the pharmacy (24 hrs) connected to the hotel sells bubble bath so I had some great bubble baths! I didn't eat at the hotel as there were all sorts of nearby eateries. The limousine bus to Haneda only operates at 4 am and then 7ish and I had to be at the airport for 7 so I had to get a taxi. This cost me about 5300 yen. You don't need to book a taxi for that time as there were many outside of the hotel. Daiba station is s few steps away from hotel.The hotel would better if the staff smiled and were more friendly. Show more ammara , United Kingdom Shinjuku Prince Hotel 7.9 Very good Based on 2751 reviews The hotel was all in all quite good. It had a very central location, our room in 22nd floor had a great view and the room itself was not bad. However there were a couple issues.. We were two friends sharing a Deluxe Twin room. The room had no place to put clothes. There were four hangers behind a mirror and that was it. The only option was to live out of our suitcases for the entire week. The cleaning was ok until one looked under the beds. Those had not seen a vacuum-cleaner for a few weeks. Very surprising since on my 25+ trips to Japan I always have been very impressed with the cleanliness wherever I have been. For a short (1-2 days) trip I can all in all recommend the hotel, but for longer stays unfortunately not. At least not if the other rooms have the same lack of storage facilities as our deluxe room. Show more Nicolai , Norway Daiwa Roynet Hotel Ginza 9 Excellent Based on 1138 reviews It's a sleek, modern and clean no frills hotel, all we needed for a Tokyo hotel to recharge at night ! Went for the deluxe double and it was well worth it for the bigger bathroom and most importantly , a proper massage chair , invaluable after a long day in the city! For the money paid I can't find a better hotel in Tokyo ! Similar priced ones are usually smaller and more basic. It's very close to three metro stations, so easy access to other parts of Tokyo like shibuya, shinjuku And skytree tower! Exploring the wonders of this city is made all the more enjoyable with a hyper-efficient rail network connected the city’s 23 wards. The vast majority of Tokyo hotels are within a few minutes’ walk of a train station or two, meaning visitors to this city have less time to worry about how to get around and more time to enjoy themselves. The JR Yamanote train line boasts the city’s most popular areas. The business traveler could very well find themselves settling into the Shinjuku area with executive class hotels. The younger crowds make their way to the shopping and nightlife area of Shibuya with its trendy bars and fashionable shopping. In the Harajuku area, visitors will find a more fashionable atmosphere with boutiques aplenty. Meiji Shrine is an excellent cultural attraction in an evergreen forest, and the tech-savvy will find a bit of paradise at Akihabara , an area famous for its incredible selection of electronics. Those traveling to Japan will most likely find themselves in Narita International Airport , the gateway serving international flights that is located about 60km from Tokyo.
